intro: Populus nigra subsp. pyramidalis, commonly known as the Weeping Poplar, is a subspecies of the black poplar native to Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive, cascading branches that give it a drooping, weeping appearance. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length and are dark green on the upper surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers in the spring followed by fluffy, cotton-like seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and parks due to its unique visual appeal.
